eligibility.title: Am I Eligible for a Transplant?
eligibility.content: Answer questions about your age, kidney disease stage, other conditions, and transplant history to see if you qualify.

roadmap_steps.step: Get a referral to a transplant center
roadmap_steps.details: Ask your nephrologist or healthcare provider for a referral.
You will undergo blood tests, imaging, and interviews to determine if you're a good candidate.

roadmap_steps.step: Join the National Transplant Waiting List
roadmap_steps.details: If approved, you will be added to the UNOS-managed list. Your position depends on several factors including blood type and urgency.
A living donor may reduce your wait time. Donors can be family or friends.

waitlist_comparison.title: Compare Waitlist Times
waitlist_comparison.action: Use OPTN explorer to compare average wait times by region and blood type.

coverage_and_rights.title: Medicare & Transplant Coverage
coverage_and_rights.content: Medicare Part B covers transplant-related drugs and services for eligible patients, even if you're under 65.
